net.sf.kdgcommons.html

Class HtmlUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.kdgcommons.html.HtmlUtil
  • Deprecated. 
    This class is now in the util package; it will be removed (with the rest of the html package) in version 2.0. Note that some functions are separately deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public class HtmlUtil
extends Object
    Static methods for working with HTML content, typically in a string.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HtmlUtil()
      Deprecated.

      Deprecated. 
      Appends an escaped attribute (name='value') to the passed buffer, which is assumed to contain an in-process HTML element string.
      static void appendOptionalAttribute(StringBuilder buf, String name, Object value)
      Deprecated. 
      Appends an escaped attribute (name='value') to the passed buffer, which is assumed to contain an in-process HTML element string, iff the attribute value is neither null nor an empty string.
      static String buildQueryString(Map<?,?> params, boolean ignoreEmpty)
      Deprecated. 
      Constructs a query string out of a parameter map, URL-encoding values.
      static String escape(String src)
      Deprecated. 
      Replaces characters in the passed string with entities: < replaced with &lt; > replaced with &gt; & replaced with &amp; " replaced with &quot; ' replaced with &#39; (this allows single quotes to be used in attribute values that are delimited by single quotes) any non-ASCII character (ie, those with codepoints > 127) with a hexadecimal Unicode escape If passed null, returns an empty string.

      Deprecated.

    • Method Detail

      • urlEncode

        @Deprecated
public static String urlEncode(String src)
        Deprecated. This function has been moved to UrlBuilder
        A wrapper around URLEncoder that always encodes to UTF-8, replaces its checked exception with a RuntimeException (that should never be thrown), and encodes spaces as "%20" rather than "+".

        If passed null, will return an empty string.

      • urlDecode

        @Deprecated
public static String urlDecode(String src)
        Deprecated. This function has been moved to UrlBuilder
        A wrapper around URLDecoder that always decodes as UTF-8, and replaces its checked exception with a RuntimeException (that should never be thrown).

        If passed null, will return an empty string.

      • escape

        public static String escape(String src)
        Deprecated. 
        Replaces characters in the passed string with entities:
        • < replaced with &lt;
        • > replaced with &gt;
        • & replaced with &amp;
        • " replaced with &quot;
        • ' replaced with &#39; (this allows single quotes to be used in attribute values that are delimited by single quotes)
        • any non-ASCII character (ie, those with codepoints > 127) with a hexadecimal Unicode escape
        If passed null, returns an empty string.

      • unescape

        public static String unescape(String src)
        Deprecated. 
        Replaces entity references in the passed string with their character values. Supports the following four named entities, as well as both hexadecimal and decimal numeric entities.
        • &lt;
        • &gt;
        • &amp;
        • &quot;

        If passed null, returns an empty string. If passed a string without any entity escapes, returns that string unchanged.

      • appendAttribute

        public static void appendAttribute(StringBuilder buf,
                                   String name,
                                   Object value)
        Deprecated. 
        Appends an escaped attribute (name='value') to the passed buffer, which is assumed to contain an in-process HTML element string.

        If value is null, will append the attribute with an empty string value. See appendOptionalAttribute(java.lang.StringBuilder, java.lang.String, java.lang.Object) if you want to skip null values.

      • appendOptionalAttribute

        public static void appendOptionalAttribute(StringBuilder buf,
                                           String name,
                                           Object value)
        Deprecated. 
        Appends an escaped attribute (name='value') to the passed buffer, which is assumed to contain an in-process HTML element string, iff the attribute value is neither null nor an empty string.

      • buildQueryString

        public static String buildQueryString(Map<?,?> params,
                                      boolean ignoreEmpty)
        Deprecated. 
        Constructs a query string out of a parameter map, URL-encoding values. This is often simpler than URLBuilder, but does not support multiple values per parameter.
        Parameters:
        params - The map of parameter values. This must contain only scalar values: both key and value are converted to strings before being added to the query string.
        ignoreEmpty - If true, entries with empty or null values are not added to the string; if false, they're added in the form "name="
        Returns:
        The query string, consisting of "name=value" pairs separated by ampersands. There's no leading question mark.

      • parseQueryString

        public static Map<String,String> parseQueryString(String query,
                                                  boolean ignoreEmpty)
        Deprecated. 
        Parses a query string into a parameter map, decoding values as needed. Does not support multiple parameter values; later values will overwrite earlier.
        Parameters:
        query - The query string: zero or more name=value pairs separated by ampersands, with or without a leading question mark.
        ignoreEmpty - If true, ignores any entries without a value (eg, "name="; if false these are added to the map with an empty string for the value.
        Returns:
        A map of the name-value pairs. Caller is permitted to modify this map.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - on any failure.

      • htmlToText

        public static String htmlToText(String input)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts HTML to plain text, according to the following rules:
        • Replaces any newlines or carriage returns in the source text with single spaces.
        • Replaces <P> and <BR> with newlines.
        • Replaces <LI> with newline followed by "* ".
        • Removes all other tags, including their attributes.
        • Leaves text behind.
        Since:
        1.0.2
